data.title: China Tells Trump That Climate Change Is No Hoax It Invented
China websites block searches for 'Fatty Kim the Third'

Researchers And Politicians Slam The War On Drugs As A Failure - " over $100 billion is spent each year on trying to enforce prohibition, but with very little effect. In 2014, around one in 20 adults around the world are thought to have used some sort of illegal drug"

A petition calling for fossil fuel lobbyists to be excluded from the UN climate change negotiations has been forced into the hands of the US delegation in Morocco, where almost 200 nations are meeting to work out ways to implement the 2015 Paris agreement to limit greenhouse gas emissions.
Scientists have found evidence that tiny, distant Pluto harbors a hidden ocean beneath the frozen surface of its heart-shaped central plain containing as much water as all of Earth's seas.
People in China are calling Kim Jong Un fat, and North Korea isn't happy about it. Chinese websites blocked searches for “Kim Fatty the Third".
A “nation-state” used Wikileaks to influence the US election, the head of the NSA says
Turkey's Erdogan could govern until 2029 under plans to change constitution
Scientists have discovered a new way to edit DNA that could fix “broken genes” in the brain, cure previously incurable diseases and potentially even extend the human lifespan.
Snowden: Stop Relying on Facebook for Your News

One of Rome’s Most Famous Sculptures Has Been Vandalized. Bernini’s “Elephant and Obelisk” is missing part of its tusk. "We owe it to future generations to look after these monuments. They don't belong to us, we are only their guardians."
Oil company announces installation of solar panels at 5,000 gas stations, first step to convert them into EV charging stations
Gaddafi ‘gave Nicolas Sarkozy €50m for 2007 presidential campaign’
U.S. warship diverts to help New Zealand quake evacuation
